DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective evaluate relationship nasopharyngeal microbial colonization occurrence AOM pneumonia infant .
DOC.criteria: Age : 1835 year Parity : history previous normal delivery Weight : Body Mass Index great 18.5 less 35 Past obstetric history : Uncomplicated pregnancy , unremarkable medical obstetric condition Current pregnancy : Uneventful progression pregnancy General health : Normal health relate functional status pregnancy Singleton pregnancy determine clinical examination and/or ultrasonography Cephalic presentation determine abdominal clinical examination Expected normal pregnancy relate outcome Written inform consent Medical history : Known history diabetes , hypertension , systemic disorder Gynecological history : History major gynecological problem/treatment Complications previous pregnancy Previous obstetric cholestasis Previous acute fatty liver disease Conditions current pregnancy 1 . RhD negative mother 2 . APH/Placental abruption 3 . Placenta Praevia 4 . Unstable lie 5 . Multiple pregnancy 6 . Pregnancy induced hypertension ( systolic > 140 mm Hg , diastolic > 90 mm Hg ) 7 . Severe preeclampsia eclampsia 8 . Gestational diabetes 9 . Onstetric cholestasis 10 . Current history drug/alcohol abuse 11 . BMI less 18.5 35 . Severe pallor detect clinically HB level ( < 7 gm/dL ) , oedema 12 . Blood sample draw test VDRL ( Positive VDRL ) Cephalopelvic disproportion ( CPD ) 13 . History take antibiotic within 3 week prior study 14 . Patient unwilling comply study protocol
